Integration

Back

 

Since VLIB is a collection of individual kernels, any combination of the kernels that comprise VLIB may be integrated into a system individually. Integration, for single or multiple kernels, requires simple steps below:

  1. Add API calls within system code
  2. Compile system code
  3. Link VLIB

The sections that follow provide details regarding the above four steps.

 

Add VLIB API Calls

Add calls to VLIB kernels within the system source code as necessary. Any system source file that contains calls to an VLIB kernel will require that the VLIB header file vlib.h is included. See the VLIB Function Reference for details on individual kernel APIs.

 

Add VLIB API Calls

To re-compile the system code, the path to the packages directory will need to be added to the compiler's include path search list. This path will depend on the VLIB root installation directory. This allows the main VLIB header file to be moved from within the installation directory and still recognize the individual kernel headers.

 

Linking VLIB

The path to the VLIB libraries must be provided to the linker via the -l directive.
